Dear Mr. Skornias
He have several questions here at KETC for t&ieh we would like your
answers based upon past N.A.E.B. experience in radio as well as television.
In setting up our operating and capital investment budgets, we were
discussing the matter of amortisation and depreciation of capital equipment.
Our accountants inform us that tbs general practice in no^-profit educational
institutions is not to depreciate equipment. Is this a standard procedure
in educational radio stations around the country? In the cost figures that
have been submitted to you by educational institutions producing programs under
an N.A.B.B. grant, has depreciation been Included?
The next item is that of engineering azxd musicians* unions. Has there

cause it poses a mere liaaedlate and continuing problem. In the September meet*

ing agreement with engineering unions but intended to have a completely non¬
union engineering staff. This is mere agreeably achieved in the small
ccnmonities than in the larger cities like St. Louis where even the Board of
